intro: [WRONG START] Embilia gossweileri, commonly known as the African star anise, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its aromatic, glandular leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny, aromatic seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique fragrance and potential medicinal properties, it is of interest in both horticultural and ethnobotanical studies.
